intro: Rhynchospora breviuscula, commonly known as the short-stemmed spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, ribbed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flower heads that are typically greenish or reddish in color, which are borne on slender, erect stems. Rhynchospora breviuscula thrives in moist soils and is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds and streams. Its ecological importance lies in its role as a habitat and food source for various invertebrates and birds.
